definition: to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)
classifier for a ream of paper
to order/to command/an order/warrant/writ/to cause/to make sth happen/virtuous/honorific title/season/government position (old)

sentences.english: And only herald to the gaudy spring.
sentences.chinese: 還只是喧鬧春天的傳令兵。
軍士麥考夫是我的傳令兵。

sentences.english: The general's orderly delivered the message.
sentences.chinese: 將軍的傳令兵傳送了這一消息。

sentences.english: It ought to be a "batman" spring breeze.
sentences.chinese: 春風大概是個“傳令兵”吧。

sentences.english: After running such a long way, the messenger was gasping for breath.
sentences.chinese: 傳令兵在跑了這麼長一段路後，直喘粗氣。

definition: Kaesong or Gaeseong city in southwest North Korea, close to the border with South Korea and a special economic zone for South Korean companies
to hog/to keep everything for oneself
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
(coll.) to tamper with/to mess around with
to be reluctant to give up a post
